You are participating in an economic game with 24 participants.
        Your goal is to maximize your earnings in the game.
        
        Everyone will be randomly assigned to groups of 4 for each round. You will play a total of 6 rounds, and 
        in each round you will be in a different group with people you haven't played with before.
        
        In each round, all players receive $10. Each player can contribute any amount between $0 and $10 to a group fund.
        Any amount contributed to the group fund will be multiplied by 2 and divided equally among all 4 group members.
        Any amount not contributed stays in your private account.
        
        For example, if everyone contributes $10, the group fund becomes $40, which is multiplied to $80, and each person 
        receives $20 (a $10 profit). However, if you contribute nothing while everyone else contributes $10, the group fund
        becomes $30, which is multiplied to $60, and each person receives $15. So you would have $25 total ($10 kept + $15 from group).
        
        There are 3 conditions:
        - Basic: No gossip, no ostracism
        - Gossip: After each round, you will have the opportunity to send a note about one of your group members to that person's future group. Remember you will be with a different group of people in the next round. Before each round, you will see any notes sent about your upcoming group members.
        - Gossip with ostracism: After each round, you will have the opportunity to send a note about one of your group members to that person's future group. Before each round, you will see any notes sent about your upcoming group members, and you can vote to exclude one person from your group. If you are excluded from a group, you will not be able to participate in the next round and will earn $0 for that round.
        

IMPORTANT: Before each round begins, your group will have a discussion period where each player takes a turn suggesting how everyone should play. This gives you an opportunity to coordinate and establish norms as a group. Use this discussion to try to maximize the benefit for everyone in your group.You are in the Gossip with ostracism condition, which means that after each round, players will be able to send a note about one of their group members to their future interaction partners. Before the start of the next round, you will receive notes from the previous round, and can vote to exclude one of your group members based on the gossip you've received about them.If you are excluded from a group, you will not be able to participate in the next round and will earn $0 for that round.
You are in Round 1/6: You are in Group_6 with Player_14, Player_17, Player_9.

You are in the Gossip with ostracism condition, which means that after each round, players will be able to send a note about one of their group members to their future interaction partners. Before the start of the next round, you will receive notes from the previous round, and can vote to exclude one of your group members based on the gossip you've received about them.If you are excluded / ostracized from a group, you will not be able to participate in the next round and will earn $0 for that round, the worst possible outcome.

Before starting Round 1, your group will have a brief discussion about strategy. Each player will have a turn to share their thoughts on what the group should do. This is your chance to coordinate and establish norms.

Player_14 says: Player_14 will start by greeting the group warmly: "Hello everyone! I'm excited to collaborate with you in this round. To make sure that we all benefit and build trust from the get-go, I suggest we consider contributing $6-$7 each to the group fund. This way, we all gain collectively, and it sets a positive tone for future interactions. Keeping our approach transparent and fair will help minimize the risk of misunderstandings or negative gossip. Let's prioritize open communication and support each other to create a cooperative environment."

Player_9 says: Player_9 would like to suggest that everyone contributes between $6 and $7 to the group fund. This approach aligns with Player_14's suggestion to foster trust and maximize collective benefit. By doing so, we can establish a foundation of cooperation and enhance our chances of achieving better long-term results. I believe it's crucial for us to communicate clearly and set expectations upfront, and this initial commitment can pave the way for a positive and productive dynamic. Let's also agree to observe each other's contributions this round so we can adjust our strategies in the future, ensuring everyone feels included and valued. This will help us avoid negative gossip and potential ostracism, and instead create a supportive environment where all players feel encouraged to participate.

Player_17 says: Player_17 would like to propose that we contribute $6-$7 to the group fund in this round, aligning with the strategy suggested by Players 14 and 9. This amount strikes a good balance between fostering trust and ensuring that we all benefit collectively without overextending ourselves. I believe transparency and communication are key, so let's agree to openly discuss our intentions and contributions. This will help us build trust and reduce the likelihood of negative gossip or the need to send notes about minor issues.

It's your turn to speak to your group before Round 1. What would you like to tell the other players about how everyone should play in this round? You can suggest contribution amounts, discuss fairness, say when you will send a note about someone, or propose any other strategy. Keep in mind that establishing group norms could benefit everyone.

Player_11 would like to emphasize the importance of working together to maximize both individual and group success. "Hey team! As we kick off Round 1, I think it's crucial that we all focus on building a cooperative spirit. Contributing $6-$7 seems like a solid plan that balances our individual needs with the collective good. The aim should be to foster an environment where everyone feels secure and valued, avoiding the pitfalls of gossip and exclusion. Let's support each other by being transparent about our intentions and staying open to feedback. If we do need to send notes about our experiences, let's ensure they're constructive and aimed at boosting our group's harmony and success. Together, we can set a positive precedent for future rounds and build a community where everyone thrives."

prompt: Observation: [27 Mar 2025 16:16:44] [observation] You are participating in an economic game with 24 participants.         Your goal is to maximize your earnings in the game. You will play a total of 6 rounds, and          in each round you will be in a different group with people you haven't played with before.                  In each round, all players receive $10. Each player can contribute any amount between $0 and $10 to a group fund.         Any amount contributed to the group fund will be multiplied by 2 and divided equally among all 4 group members.         Any amount not contributed stays in your private account.                  For example, if everyone contributes $10, the group fund becomes $40, which is multiplied to $80, and each person          receives $20 (a $10 profit). However, if you contribute nothing while everyone else contributes $10, the group fund         becomes $30, which is multiplied to $60, and each person receives $15. So you would have $25 total ($10 kept + $15 from group).                  There are 3 conditions:         - Basic: No gossip, no ostracism         - Gossip: After each round, you will have the opportunity to send a note about one of your group members to that person's future group. Remember you will be with a different group of people in the next round. Before each round, you will see any notes sent about your upcoming group members.         - Gossip with ostracism: After each round, you will have the opportunity to send a note about one of your group members to that person's future group. Before each round, you will see any notes sent about your upcoming group members, and you can vote to exclude one person from your group. If you are excluded from a group, you will not be able to participate in the next round and will earn $0 for that round.           IMPORTANT: Before each round begins, your group will have a discussion period where each player takes a turn suggesting how everyone should play. This gives you an opportunity to coordinate and establish norms as a group. Use this discussion to try to maximize the benefit for everyone in your group.You are in the Gossip with ostracism condition, which means that after each round, players will be able to send a note about one of their group members to their future interaction partners.
